column4: yert, my drivers are working fine now ;) it was just something I always wondered how it worked.
has anyone experienced problems with Wine @ installing programs that require a serial or registration number?
If you see an nvidia splashcreen during boot-up, you're good!
yert, I've tried installing photoshop and a screenwriting program, both require a key, but they spit it back saying it's incorrect.  Is it trying to do something with c++ in the background, maybe?
after a while, the flash videos play real choppy and at times I have to close the browser.  any suggestions?
yert, it's an older version, 7.0
no problem yert, I appreciate the help.
Hey, you guys are a great help!  Thanks, and take it easy!
Bye
I have XP and Ubuntu on my computer.  My burner works ok in XP but I can't burn anything in Ubuntu.  Any suggestions?
what program are you usign to burn with?
is ubuntu atleast recognizing the drive?
right
i personally dont burn many things onto discs
but a friend of mine does, im trying to remember what program he uses
it wasn't one of the ones you mentioned using
what kind of files are you trying to burn?
since some programs are better then others with specific file types
i get the feeling its got something to do with the buffer, but im not entirely sure
not that i know of, but the buffer is what usually freezes computers (atleast for me) when a burning process is being attempted
ok
